Reviews.Title: Crisp Standard-Definition Picture/Great For Bedroom
Reviews.Author: Nagshead "'Net addict"
Reviews.Content: After a period of adjustment, I've come to be quite pleased with the quality of this TV.  Standard-Definition looks crisp on this TV - and, after having seen the way other brands of TV render standard-definition signals (when I was trying to see if a different TV would be a better fit) - I have to believe that this Samsung TV is among the very best among the recent "entry-level" TVs  at displaying standard-definition TV.  It's good to know that Samsung hasn't completely neglected the consumer who still watches standard-definition TV - for I imagine that there are many other people out there who need a new TV, but cannot commit to the greater expense of high-definition TV.1ST SET DEFECTIVE, 2ND SET FINE: The original Samsung UN26D4003 that arrived at my door had a couple of problems.  There were a few areas on the screen that looked "washed out" (particularly when displaying black and/or dark images) - as though the "pixels" in these areas were not functioning up-to-par.  And the overall standard-definition picture left a little to be desired - at least when you stood closely to the screen.  Somehow, I thought that it was possible that I had received a defective set - instead of it being a problem with all Samsung UN26D4003s.  So I contacted Amazon about the problem - and Amazon was wonderful about shipping (completely free-of-cost) another set to me right away.  Sure enough, the problems I had with the first set have been absent with the replacement set.  Once things "settled down", I realized that this set really delivers on the quality.SMALL FOOTPRINT: One of the things I like so much about this TV is that - for a TV with a 26" screen-size - it has a small footprint.  You can check out the published dimensions for yourself.  The borders of the TV are very thin, and there is no visible "speaker bar" underneath the bottom border.  These facts contribute to the TV's simple, elegant look: other 26" TVs look bulky in comparison.  The TV's smaller footprint saves me precious inches in a modestly-sized, cramped bedroom.NO PROBLEMS WITH STANDARD-DEFINITION (4:3):  There was another reviewer - Stan - who had the complaint that the Samsung wasn't displaying the full standard-definition picture of his DirecTV.  That review made me hesitate a bit in buying this TV - but after rationalizing that Stan's review didn't mean that I would have the same problem, I went ahead and pulled the trigger on the purchase.  Sure enough, I was relieved when I had no such problems.  The standard-definition picture of my Comcast Cable has fit the screen perfectly.  The default display mode is NOT "Zoom" (the setting that gave Stan some problems) - but "16:9".  The "16:9" setting does not cut off any part of the picture - and it fills the screen when displaying scenes that were intended to fill the screen.  In order to ensure that the picture fills the screen perfectly - be sure that the correct setting is selected.  With this Samsung, this setting is NOT called "Zoom" - but "16:9".BLACK BARS NOT SAMSUNG TV'S FAULT:  Sometimes, I will watch shows in which the picture does NOT fill the entire screen - black bars will appear across the top and bottom.  Whenever this happens (and it happens somewhat frequently) - I know that this is NOT a flaw of the Samsung TV, or even my cable company.  It's due to how the show's producer, or the TV station on which the show appears - decides to display its product.  It has become a little bit of a trend for companies to broadcast their shows in a widescreen format - with the black bars on the top and bottom.  For example, I believe Fox TV is now showing NFL games like this - and ESPN seems to now broadcast most of its shows like this, as well.  There is no setting on any TV that will "fix" this.  I don't really mind when shows are displayed like this - I'm pretty used to it, and am barely conscious of it.  If anyone has a problem with this, there is really nothing you can do but take it up with the TV station or the show's producer.CHECK WITH YOUR CABLE/SATELLITE PROVIDER (IF NEEDED):  Apparently, it is possible to make some picture adjustments through your cable's on-screen menu or DirecTV's menu - so if you encounter any problems that you think could/should be fixable, an additional option is to try to fix the problem via your cable/satellite box or company.LOTS OF OPTIONS FOR PICTURE ADJUSTMENTS: This Samsung offers a vast array of picture adjustments - considerably more than most "entry level" TVs.  This review has gotten long - so you can check the user manual on the Samsung website for further detail.  But if you're anything like me and need to have lower brightness levels and "warmer" colors - this is a great TV to have.  It's also great if you like your TV very bright - and/or with vivid colors.  There are several settings that allow you to "fine tune" the picture to your liking - including "Advanced Settings".BIG SOUND, LOTS OF OPTIONS FOR SOUND ADJUSTMENTS:  The sound is more than adequate for my bedroom.  Heck, as far as I'm concerned, the sound would probably be good even in a large living room.  The volume goes all the way to "100" - and rarely do I need to have it above "15".  Much of the time, I have it below "15".  And there are an array of sound-settings which you can select to make those "finer" adjustments:  for ex., there is a setting that supposedly enhances people's voices above the "background noise", and a setting that is "ideal" for music.  You can activate SRS TruSurround HD on this TV - which gives more of a "movie theater" quality to the sound.ONLY ONE A/V-COMPONENT INPUT:  One thing about this TV that may be a drawback is that it only has one A/V input.  Furthermore, this A/V input is actually a combined A/V-component input - so you cannot hook up a device that uses A/V (a.k.a. composite) connections and a device that uses component connections at the same time.  For those of you who don't need these inputs - or only need to hook up one A/V or component device - this isn't really a problem.  But for those of you who need to hook up 2 or more "older" devices that connect via A/V or component - you may be frustrated.  It may be possible to get around this limitation by getting a "component to HDMI" adapter or a "composite to HDMI" converter - but I'm not  knowledgeable or experienced about this, so I don't know how well this works.DISPLAYS MY VCR/DVD IMAGES WELL:  I have a VCR/DVD recorder hooked up to this Samsung TV via the A/V input - and I've been pleased with the quality of the images.CUTE FEATURE:  one small, endearing feature of this TV is that it makes a gentle "chime" sound when you power it on or off.SMALL INACCURACY IN AMAZON'S DESCRIPTION:  I can assure you that the screen diagonal is a full 26", not the 25.5" that Amazon lists in the specifications above.Overall, this TV lives up to Samsung's good name.  4 stars instead of 5 - simply because I would have liked to have had an extra A/V-composite input.

Reviews.Title: Shame
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: Great picture and is perfect as a bedroom set, however the lack of ports and the fact that there is no Audio out just keeps this from being a 5 Star product. Honestly don't understand what Samsung was thinking with so little ports and options. To make things worst, the pair of speakers are only 5 watts so don't expect much.Decent buy, could have been better if the speakers were better or had audio out port.

Reviews.Title: No Audio Output
Reviews.Author: LeimanH
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is fantastic but..., there is no audio output on this TV.  Probably does not matter to most people.  If you are hooking up surround sound, does not matter.  Personally, I have been more than happy with the sound quality of a couple of good quality PC speakers hooked up to the headphone jack of my previous TVs.  This allows volume to be controlled with the existing remote control and results in easier hook-up and less cable clutter.  You cannot do that with this TV and you probably will not be satisfied with the built-in speakers on this TV. (Update:  Built-in speaker performance improved significantly after changing sound mode to "Movie" and turning "Tru-surround HD" and "Auto Volume" on.  Still not as good as external speakers though).Checked four other televisions for sale on Amazon (2 Samsungs, a Panasonics and an LG) just to make sure this feature hadn't been phased out industry-wide and 3 of the 4 had audio output and one had an actual headphone jack.So, if you want to hook your TV up to speakers without losing your ability to control the volume through the same remote, keep shopping.I just assumed all TVs had some kind of audio output.

Reviews.Title: Horrible!
Reviews.Author: R. Low "HIS body HIS decision"
Reviews.Content: This TV set has NO AUDIO OUTPUT or HEADPHONE JACK.The only way to hear it is through the tiny rear-facing speakers.WHAT ON EARTH is Samsung thinking?

Reviews.Title: Samsung is always Sweet!!!
Reviews.Author: Dean A. Deyot
Reviews.Content: I always buy samsung Tv's and this one did not let me Down!!! The Pix is awesome its my first LED Tv But probably not my last. The pix is very crisp even in standard tv Mode And HD is Amazzzzzzzing!!!!! The sound Is pretty Good Too For a 26inc NOt the best But good enough For My Bedroom!!! I would Def Recommend this Tv too people I am A loyal Samsung Customer I always Will be!!!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED 26" TV
Reviews.Author: hopalong1
Reviews.Content: This TV is really nice for our kitchen because it fits under the cabenet at only 16.5" tall.  The picture is sharp and vibrant.  Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S.
Reviews.Content: This TV looks great and more importantly, there is nothing wrong with the sound other than it doesn't have audio outputs or inputs. I have been reading that the sound is horrible and too quiet but I played around with the controls and I think I have discovered the problem. You must go to the sound menu and then turn on the auto volume! The volume instantly got louder. The picture is crisp and colorful and bright and I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Decent Display for the money
Reviews.Author: bikegeek
Reviews.Content: Picked this up to be a TV in my bedroom.  It works great, though using a standard definition signal for cable doesn't seem to work to well.  Some times the channels look like they are cut off if it is in full screen mode, and in wide screen mode everyone looks really fat.  This doesn't happen on my Sony LCD, or any other Samsung LCDs I have, but with those I did spend more for the TVs, so I figure it is the "level" of TV I purchased.When watching movies, or anything with a HD signal though the TV is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Grandpa
Reviews.Content: The Samsung television has been in our kitchen for about two weeks - no problems. The television is light and fit up on a built out shelf perfectly. The package was sustantial and thus no damage during shipping even though the edges of the box were worn. The set up of the televisoin was easy and accomplished in about 15 minutes. The picture is what I have grown to expect from Samsung - excellent. I like everything about the set except the sound is somewhat lacking. I am considering adding a sound bar or something like that to enhance the sound. Overall, very pleased with the set.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: LARRY E. THOMPSON "PopTop"
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV with a great price.  Just what I needed for the bedroom. My only problem was that I ordered the VideoSecu wall mount at the same time and the two weren't compatable.  The TV has VESA mounting holes spaced at 100mm x 200mm, while the mount only has 100mm x 100mm.  I made two adapters from some 1/8" x 3/4" aluminum stock which I fastened to the mount so that I could drill holes at 200mm spacing.  Everything worked out great.

Reviews.Title: Top Quality
Reviews.Author: James Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased by this television.  I spent a few hours in different stores comparing pictures and it certainly seemed like the best quality of them all.  Once I got this one at home, I was pleased that the quality of the sound was also excellent.  The remote is also very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, easy setup
Reviews.Author: Ken R
Reviews.Content: Needed a digital receiver to take advantage of digital cable signal, so we bought this based upon price and Samsung name. Setup was easy (unit is fairly light), and the picture is great. Really takes advantage of HD signal.Wish we could have gotten a bigger TV, but his was the biggest unit that would fit the cabinet.

Reviews.Title: Fine LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: RMP
Reviews.Content: This TV was very easy to set up and has a great picture.  However I would recommend a stronger base to support it when it is sitting on a piece of furniture or use a wall mount.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: tct
Reviews.Content: Bought this to mount on the wall in our kitchen.  I have a larger Samsung LCD TV and Samsung Blu-Ray Player that I've been very happy with and I am just as happy with this one.  Video is incredibly sharp and the audio is fine despite what some reviewers have said.  The speakers do point downward from the bottom edge of the screen, but it is not an issue for me, and it is plenty loud and clear.  I was concerned that the 720p video would appear a little grainy, but at this screen size it looks as sharp as 1080p to me.  The overall exterior appearance is sleek with a thin frame and the Samsung remote is well designed and attractive, and the same style as other Samsung remotes.  Easy setup and controls, and a very readable and useful instruction book (not a folded one-pager like some).  Consumer magazines have often rated Samsung one of the top brands for TVs, and I totally agree.  I would buy another.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN26D4003 26-Inches 720p 60Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Maggie
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the Customer Service with questions I had buying the TV online.  It came right to my door within a few days of ordering, and instructions on assembling the stand were clear and easy to follow.  I absolutely love the TV.  The picture images are sharp, and the 26 in. screen is a perfect size for my small apartment.  I would highly recommend this HD TV.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Much bigger than 23 inches...
Reviews.Author: AmazonJunkie
Reviews.Content: Intro: Buying this TV was worth every penny of its already reasonable price tag. Samsung is the leader intelevision design these days, so you can't go wrong if you're buying one. This 26" is a lot more impressive,size-wise, than you would imagine. If you own anything 23" or lower, you will be impressed at how muchbigger this seems.Picture: Plugging this thing into anything HDMI ready will give you crystal clear images and decent soundquality. If you don't usually use a sound system or external speakers with your TV, then the sound qualityon this may even be above your usual standards.Getting the most from your Samsung 26": Many people complain about the lack of inputs on this TV andthat would be reasonable if things like this didn't exist:3 Port HDMI Pigtail Switch with 55 cm HDMI CableIt'll turn 2 HDMI ports into 4, which should be enough for any entertainment unit. And as for sound quality,if you're looking for more depth, richness or overall oomph, most media receivers STILL have thered/white audio cables that you can source to an awesome sound system which will turn this TV into theultimate entertainment experience for the price.

Reviews.Title: Right Size and Slim
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Ansell
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the bedroom....looking for a TV that fit the room size and provided good quality picture (at a good price)This is the 2011 model. I looked at the 2012 model in a big box store (always a good thing to do before buying on-line)The 2012 model is much thicker (deeper) maybe 2 - 3 inches. So for me this was a no-brainer I wanted slim, and this is sliiiim!Setup was simple and quick. I tweaked the default setup a little, but that was also very easy. The picture quality is good, the sound is good and the "hook-ups" are fine for what I purchased the TV for. Assuming that the lifetime of the TV is good (my last Samsung lasted 2 years before problems started) I have no complaints about this Samsung TV. Good Value.Did I say it is really slim?

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: PD1024
Reviews.Content: Absolutly love it!!!! Beautiful picture quality!! Always wanted a LED tv and now that I have it...I am so glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: magiziel
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my parents' small bedroom..size of it is perfect for their small bedroom. Very easy to navigate controls..only complaint from my dad is that the volume is on the lower side; I have no issues with it and don't hear it to be that low. Picture quality is great too :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture
Reviews.Author: roger r.
Reviews.Content: I have only had this 26" TV for a couple of weeks.  What I can say is that the quality of the picture seems excellent to me. Purchased through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG 26" LED HD TV
Reviews.Author: rantunes
Reviews.Content: SAMSUNG Television is an outstanding buy.  Picture is very brillant and TV functions are extremely easy.  Better picture than my Sony 32" Bravia.  Arrived extremely well packaged. I would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price
Reviews.Author: beach lover
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest, I purchase all of the electronics in our house and I'm a huge home theatre guy so when I discovered that my wife had ordered this without my knowledge for our daughters bedroom I was concerned.Now I havent spent alot of time with the TV but I did install the stand which was extremely easy, hooked it up and got it going.It looks pretty good even with SD shows. We have not hooked it up to HD yet because thats another $100 for a direc tv receiver. But it seems to have plenty of adjustments for picture, contrast etc...I would say for a bedroom its a pretty solid purchase.

Reviews.Title: It came quickly and was what we ordered
Reviews.Author: wooly
Reviews.Content: My tv came quickly and was what we ordered. There were no problems and I would order from them again.

Reviews.Title: Love it""
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: Great TV. After reading other reviews at Amazon, this sounded like a great extra TV for the bed room.  I was kind of worried about how it would sound being a small TV, but it was really good and sounded  great for it's size. Also the picture quality was really good for a non HD application. Yes this TV was a great find at Amazon. JD

Reviews.Title: Great Little TV
Reviews.Author: Avacarmona
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN26D4003 26-Inches 720p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)My husband and I purchased this TV after looking at quite a few and reading many of the reviews on Amazon. We wanted a flat screen TV for our bedroom, and had a small shelf space on the wall across for our bed. Size was important, and this TV is compact but has a great picture. We liked the fact that the base is small, so we could place it very close to the wall. The other thing we needed was a QAM filter so that we could use this with Comcast's digital network, without renting their box. This works perfectly. We think the sound is great and this TV has good value for the  money.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture
Reviews.Author: C.D.Terry
Reviews.Content: Item was received in perfect condition and before estimated delivery date.  Picture has great color, tv settings and setup are very easily accomplished.  Over the air antenna HD programming is amazing.  Would recommend to buy.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN26D4003 26-Inches 720p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Happy Experience
Reviews.Content: I am keeping this Samsung 26" 720p Led HDTV with decent/good sound quality after turning on the "SRS", "Auto volume" and "Clear Voice" options; over a 32" 1080p HD/Led TV for my 250 sqft master bedroom. Althought I paid a little more than the 32", but the "Samsung" quality prove that it's worthy.Need to get a light weight turn-table which can support the weight of less than 10 lbs.

Reviews.Title: Terrible sound quality
Reviews.Author: The Englishman
Reviews.Content: Bought this in November 2011 looking for a decent 26" TV.  Its basically has what you need for a a simple TV.  Unfortunately the sound quality is just not up to par at all.  Very tinny sounding with no low frequency bass sound at all.  Sounds like a cheap set ot PC speakers.  BUT the worst part is that there is NO audio out of any kind.  I thought this would be a given, at least a headphone jack that I could connect an external sound system too but there is nothing at all.Unfortunately the sound really detracts from the experience so its 3 stars max for this just based on it being an LED 26" for $270

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV Product
Reviews.Author: Alexander Harris
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this HDTV.  It is perfect for viewing in a small room.  The sound is respectable, but more importantly, the picture is fantastic.  I recommend this TV for anyone looking for high quality at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: very quiet
Reviews.Author: Finny
Reviews.Content: Good picture, light weight, but super quiet.  Don't buy unless you have external speakers. I need six more words here.

Reviews.Title: Tenconman
Reviews.Author: Margaret M Hare
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Tenconman. Con Man says it all.Forget the Ten. Go to Best Buy or anywhere else.This was a defective piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: for my office
Reviews.Author: follownobody
Reviews.Content: have had this for quite some time now.  I love Samsung TVs and have several of them in my home.  We have had no problems with any of them.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Billie A. Brunsman
Reviews.Content: We love this TV and use ir very often - quality is fantastic.  I is a great product and we own several od this product

Reviews.Title: No audio out of any kind
Reviews.Author: Technik
Reviews.Content: No digital audio out, no analog audio out, no headphone jack.  Why why why would you make a TV obviously designed for a small room without a headphone jack?  Your only option is the units 5 w rear facing speaker.  So during the day - can't hear it.  At night - can't watch because I don't want to wake my roommate up.  It's really too bad - I would have given this 5+ stars because it is an amazing tv with awesome picture.  Too bad I can't watch it.  FYI - I see they fixed this in the 2012 model.  Buy that one, it's awesome.  DON'T buy this one please make sure Samsung learned their lesson on this design.

Reviews.Title: samsung doesn't care about compatibility of its own products
Reviews.Author: unhappy customer
Reviews.Content: I have a samsung sound bar (Samsung HW-D450 AudioBar Home Theater System) which was connected to my older samsung TV (Samsung UN22C4000 22-Inch 720p 60 Hz LED HDTV (Black)) using the optical cable. I bought this new Samsung TV that I am reviewing (Samsung UN26D4003 26-Inches 720p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black) [2011 MODEL]) which is more advanced than my previous one and even has HDMI conenction. To my surprise, the new TV does not have a connection for the optical cable. The only soultion will be to connect the home theater to the TV using the audio cable. In other words, although I have a newer TV, with better connection technology (HDMI) I am stuck using a connection that is worse than what I had before. Clearly folks at Samsung didn't care if someone had a sound bar with optical cable and no HDMI when they created their HDMI TVs. After two Samsung TVs, a home theater and two DVDs, I guess that is it. Next time I will go back to Sony!

Reviews.Title: Den tv
Reviews.Author: special ed
Reviews.Content: Tv was back ordered. Arrived within a week of ordering. We were pleased with shipper who communicated concerning the delay. We are pleased with picture quality and size in our den. Volume control/quality is adequate but not ideal. We have similar issues with our 19 inch Samsung kitchen tv...week audio.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Good Value
Reviews.Author: Gambling Grandma
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture, excellent sound, easy to set-up.  Fast delivery.  Just the right size for viewing while sitting at my desk working on my computer.

Reviews.Title: No audio out... how does this happen in 2012?
Reviews.Author: Narto Gunawan "Felix Gunawan"
Reviews.Content: This LED TV looks SHARP when watching high definition channels.  It is light and extremely thin and up to par with my expectations from Samsung.  I tried to use this as a secondary monitor for my Mac Mini and it looks terrible.  I realize this is a TV and not made as a monitor for a computer but I figured as an LED with 1080p resolution, it would look alright.  Well I was wrong.  My other monitor is a 24" Samsung LCD that's made for a computer and it is about 10x clearer when looking at text/emails.  I also don't understand what Samsung was doing when they decided to include an audio out input...headphone jack or RCA... at least give me ONE option! Your only option for audio out here is getting an HDMI audio receiver/amplifier and run it through that.  If it had an Audio Out I would give it a 5/5 but since it does not have one I'm going to have to rate this a 4/5.

Reviews.Title: Great Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Hi-Tech Geek
Reviews.Content: Worked great right out of the box.On the down side, I wish the remote was illuminated, and the on screen menu should have larger font.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN26D4003 26" LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: J. Boyle
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for a bargain price through Amazon.  It is a great little TV and for viewing size it meets every expectation for using in a bedroom.  Reading reviews, many people find fault with the audio quality.  I find that audio is just average.  I did have to spend some time in tweaking the audio settings and found that by not having the audio leveling on, quality is improved. Video quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!
Reviews.Author: Maka
Reviews.Content: This tv is just the right size for a small room.  The picture and volume is great for being so small.  Yes, I have bigger TV's but this one is a perfect bedroom TV! :) 5 STAR!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent image - no audio out
Reviews.Author: W. Hohauser
Reviews.Content: The image quality is typical for Samsung which is excellent. However, and I have myself to blame, I assumed that it came with the same input and output options as all my other Samsung monitor purchases. As with most Samsung monitors I have experience with, the speakers are terrible so I have external audio speakers set up. The old 23" Samsung LCD TV this replaced had an analog audio loop that output whichever source you had picked, HDMI, broadcast, etc. My 32" Samsung has an analog and an optical audio out. Even my cheap Samsung computer monitor has an audio out. My surprise was to find out that this monitor has no provisions to hook up your own sound system. I managed to set my self up with an RCA analog switcher, http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0014KOAD8/ref=oh_o00_s00_i00_details, to get the audio from my BluRay and the cable box to the external speakers but it means that for now I can't use the TV remote to switch the audio or control the BluRay sound. It would be nice if someone made a smaller sound bar that switched HDMI.

Reviews.Title: For the price, not impressed.
Reviews.Author: justsomeguy
Reviews.Content: I would say picture quality is fine: I have tried the various inputs and HD programming, etc, looks excellent. It's a thin and super-light unit which works well.It has hardly any inputs: 2 HDMI and one Composite.  One Coax input as well.  No additional Composite inputs or optical or the old RGB hookups.  I need several older devices to plug into this but just can't do it.  For the space available, it was the largest unit we could get at Best Buy, and for the price, I'm just not sold on it.  It looks good, but really needs way more inputs.The "switches" on the front of the unit (on/off, etc) are invisible, and aren't buttons at all but touch-switches.  I thought this was cool, but in dim light, you can't see where you need to press.  I have older people using this TV and that annoys them.  6 remotes sometimes they just want to press ON on the thing they want to turn ON!!!

Reviews.Title: Great picture, tin can speakers
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews and was hoping the reviewers were just being critical about the speakers because it was a 26" tv and the speakers were normal speakers for a tv this size. I have to say i should have listened as the speakers have an annoying buzzing noise when watching movies. I am debating whether or not to return this as it is for the guest bedroom and I already mounted it. As a Samsung enthusiast owning 5 other samsung TV's, i have to say I am a little disappointed in this TV. I mean really samsung, what were you thinking by not including audio out, what did you save, $3.00 a unit in production?  I could at least have picked up a cheap soundbar to compensate for this short coming. on the other hand the picture is nice and crisp as expected from a Samsung TV and it is very light and thin.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Mark Hartman
Reviews.Content: This is really close to what it was advertised as. This helped greatly for fitting on the shelf it was purchased for.

Reviews.Title: Good buy but with a problem
Reviews.Author: A. Hayward
Reviews.Content: The TV works fine.  My problem is that the cable tv master control does not work the sound on the tv.  The remote that came with the tv works fine but I have to use both that one and the cable box remote to watch tv. I am sure this is not the fault of the tv since the remote that came with it works fine.

Reviews.Title: Weak attachment to the Base
Reviews.Author: mopngobrite
Reviews.Content: I just picked up this TV after returning a Sharp LCD that was not nearly as nice.  The picture is very nice even out of the box.  The field of view seems to be good at wider angles.(That was my main reason for returning the Sharp)  The sound as others have noted is OK.  That seems to be very common, especially on TV's of this size and price.  My biggest concern is on the attachment of the base to the screen.  There are only 2 short screws to tighten and you don't want to over tighten and strip out the plastic. At best there is a good bit of wobble, and this attachment seems barely adequate.  I know that this does not receive a lot of daily adjustment, but it does not inspire confidence.

Reviews.Title: Great Product at an amazing Price
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Arrived quickly.  Plugged it in and no issues.  Love the automatic feature where it removes scrambled channels as it does the scan for channels from your cable company.  It only leaves the ones you can actually see, which my other TVs haven't done before.Remote is great.  Simple to use.It actually pulls in some pretty good detail on the channels as to what is playing, etc. (even without a cable box hooked up), just with the features built into the TV.It doesn't have 1080P, but who are you kidding!  You don't need it on a 26" TV.  Don't listen to anyone that tells you otherwise.  You won't notice the difference.Picture quality is rather good.  Crisp and clear.  Color has a slight yellow cast, but I haven't tried to mess with the settings (and there are many).As the other reviews state, there is no audio out.  If you are expecting big sound from this thing forget it.  Its a small, inexpensive TV that has small inexpensive speakers.  But it only costs $229!  We have it in our bedroom and the sound is fine.  If you want to watch movies, you probably would want it on a 42" unit or bigger anyway.I highly recommend it as a casual TV or one for a smaller room.Match your expectations to the price and size......

Reviews.Title: A major problem
Reviews.Author: stan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV but has a problem.  I would have liked to return it but the carton was disposed of.  Amazon apparently has no customer service so I am stuck with it.I am using this TV with DirecTV.  Most of their programs are coming thru with 480iand I do not get a full screen picture.  The manual states to use zoom, but when I do that, part of the picture is missing and half of the closed caption. Also any box scores when live sports are on will not show. the "use full screen" button will not work with the 480.  I have called Samsung twice and they just say, use zoom!If you do not use zoom you get a full picture with a black horizontal bar across the top and bottom of the screen.  NOT A GOOD DEAL!!!!!A friend has a Samsung, slightly larger screen, with no problems.  Samsung had no comment when I pointed this out to them????
